byline.contributor: Amy Chozick contributed reporting from North Charleston, S.C.

abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton's past work on behalf of Wall Street banks has become liability for her during 2016 presidential campaign, with many in Democratic party believing she would be too soft on industry that has fallen into deep disfavor; Clinton still leads in polls but issue could harm enthusiasm among party base if she is nominated.
lead_paragraph: At a time when liberals are ascendant in the party, some Democrats believe Hillary Rodham Clinton’s time representing Wall Street as a senator could become a vulnerability.

headline.main: Wall St. Ties Linger as Image Issue for Hillary Clinton
headline.print_headline: Clinton Battles Image of Being Soft on Wall St.

snippet: At a time when liberals are ascendant in the party, some Democrats believe Hillary Rodham Clinton’s time representing Wall Street as a senator could become a vulnerability.
